alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Eastern Chester; Eastern Montgomery; Lower Bucks; Northampton; Philadelphia; Upper Bucks; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 17 at 1:42AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A line of heavy rain showers with embedded thunderstorms and strong winds will impact portions of northeastern New Castle, northwestern Ocean, Camden, Mercer, southern Somerset, northwestern Atlantic, southern Hunterdon, Gloucester, Burlington, central Monmouth, Middlesex, Montgomery, Bucks, southeastern Chester, Philadelphia, Delaware and south central Northampton Counties through 245 AM EST... At 141 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Elam to near Wading River. Movement was north at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Trenton, Camden, New Brunswick, Easton, Gloucester City, Somerset, Cherry Hill, Middletown, Old Bridge, Bensalem, Jackson, East Brunswick, Evesham, South Brunswick, Mount Laurel, North Brunswick, Marlboro, Manalapan and Ewing. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 2 and 9. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 321 and 359. Northeast Extension between mile markers 21 and 38. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 40. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 19 and 23. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 351. Interstate 76 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 71 and 74. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 27. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 9 and 76. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. Interstate 676 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 19. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 113 and 122. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 22 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Delaware; Eastern Chester; Eastern Montgomery; Lower Bucks; Northampton; Philadelphia; Upper Bucks; Western Montgomery
